type.title: Short title. 2-
type.context: LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT under Short title. 2-1.  This Act may be cited as the Lands Department Act.  2-
type.description: This Act may be cited as the Lands Department Act.  2-

type.name: section
type.title: [Repealed by Act No. 15 of 1999]  PROVISIONS AS TO STATE LANDS
type.context: LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT under [Repealed by Act No. 15 of 1999]  PROVISIONS AS TO STATE LANDS  5. [Repealed by Act. No. 15 of 1999]

type.name: section
type.title: Surveys of State lands.
type.context: LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT under Surveys of State lands. 6. (1) Subject to the provisions of subsection (2), the department shall execute all surveys of State land of which a grant, or licence, or permission of occupancy is to be issued, and of which a survey is required.  (2) The Minister may in any case permit any duly qualified surveyor other than a surveyor of the department to execute the survey.

description.description: Subject to the provisions of subsection
The Minister may in any case permit any duly qualified surveyor other than a surveyor of the department to execute the survey.

type.name: section
type.title: Keeping of registers of grants and licences.  PROVISIONS AS TO GOVERNMENT LANDS
type.context: LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT under Keeping of registers of grants and licences.  PROVISIONS AS TO GOVERNMENT LANDS  7.  The department shall keep proper registers of all grants of state lands, or any licences connected therewith, heretofore issued, so far as they can be ascertained, and shall keep proper registers of all the grants and licences hereafter to be issued.  PROVISION  AS  TO  GOVERNMENT  LANDS
type.description: The department shall keep proper registers of all grants of state lands, or any licences connected therewith, heretofore issued, so far as they can be ascertained, and shall keep proper registers of all the grants and licences hereafter to be issued.  PROVISION  AS  TO  GOVERNMENT  LANDS

type.description: [Repealed by Act. No. 15 of 1999]  CHAPTER 59:01  LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT  LAWS OF GUYANA Lands Department Cap. 59:01 5  L.R.O. 1/2012 Registers.      Rental or sale. [9 of 1977 6 of 1997]        c .98:03

type.name: section
type.title: Registers.
type.context: LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT under Registers. 9.  The department shall keep proper and separate registers of all Government lands.
type.description: The department shall keep proper and separate registers of all Government lands.

type.name: section
type.title: Rental or sale.
type.context: LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT under Rental or sale. 10. (1) Government lands shall only be rented or sold with the sanction of the President and on the terms and conditions determined by him.  (2) Wherever labour is employed on Government lands which are subject to a lease or permission, any person on producing proof to the holder of the lease, licence or permission, or to his agent, that he is a representative of a trade union registered under the Trade Union Act, or an official of an organisation approved by order of the Minister responsible for labour for the purposes of this section, may enter at any reasonable time any such Government lands for the purpose of  (a)       holding discussions with persons employed thereon on the conditions of their employment;  (b)    making representations to the employer on behalf of the persons so employed; or  (c)   recruiting persons so employed as members of the trade union or organisation, as the case may be.  (3) The requirement to permit an entry authorised by subsection (2) shall be deemed a condition of every lease, licence or permission to which that subsection applies and a breach of that condition on more than one occasion shall render the lease, licence or permission liable to be cancelled or revoked, as the case may be.  (4) Any person who hinders or obstructs a representative or official referred to in subsection (2) in the exercise of his powers of entry under that subsection or in the LAWS OF GUYANA 6 Cap. 59:01 Lands Department   L.R.O. 1/2012                          Conveyances.               President may direct conveyance of Government lands without payment of fee. [4 of 1972]       Right of inspection of carrying out of the purposes thereof shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine of eight thousand two hundred and fifty dollars and to imprisonment for three months.  (5) Any person who falsely holds himself out as a person authorised to enter upon Government lands by virtue of this section (the burden of proof that he is so authorised being upon him) shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine of twenty-seven thousand five hundred dollars and to imprisonment for six months.  (6) The provisions of subsections (2) to (5) inclusive shall in so far as they apply to a representative of a trade union or an official apply mutatis mutandis to a Member of the National Assembly for the purposes of the exercise by him of the privileges and powers conferred by subsection 2(a) upon such a representative or official.

description.description: Government lands shall only be rented or sold with the sanction of the President and on the terms and conditions determined by him.
holding discussions with persons employed thereon on the conditions of their employment;

recruiting persons so employed as members of the trade union or organisation, as the case may be.

type.name: section
type.title: Conveyances.
type.context: LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT under Conveyances. 11. (1) Where Government land  is  to  be  purchased  or  sold, conveyance thereof for and on behalf of the Government, after the authority of the President has been obtained, may be taken or made by the Commissioner or other officer authorised by the President to do so.  (2) No conveyance of any Government land shall be made to and in favour of anyone until it has been registered by the Commissioner.

description.description: Where Government land  is  to  be  purchased  or  sold, conveyance thereof for and on behalf of the Government, after the authority of the President has been obtained, may be taken or made by the Commissioner or other officer authorised by the President to do so.
No conveyance of any Government land shall be made to and in favour of anyone until it has been registered by the Commissioner.

type.name: section
type.title: President may direct conveyance of Government lands without payment of fee.  REGISTERS AND FEES
type.context: LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT under President may direct conveyance of Government lands without payment of fee.  REGISTERS AND FEES  12.  Where the President authorises a conveyance of any of the Government  lands  being  made,  the   President   may  direct  the conveyance to be made without the payment of a fee or on the payment of any specified fee not exceeding the fee for the time being payable by law.  REGISTERS  AND  FEES
type.description: Where the President authorises a conveyance of any of the Government  lands  being  made,  the   President   may  direct  the conveyance to be made without the payment of a fee or on the payment of any specified fee not exceeding the fee for the time being payable by law.  REGISTERS  AND  FEES

type.title: Right of inspection of registers.

(2) Anyone who satisfies the Commissioner that he has an interest  therein,  may  obtain  a  certified  copy  of  any  register  or document in the possession of the department, on payment of the prescribed fee.

type.name: section
type.title: Fees.  MISCELLANEOUS
type.context: LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT under Fees.  MISCELLANEOUS  14.  The prescribed fees shall be those specified in the Schedule as amended from time to time by order of the Minister subject to negative resolution of the National Assembly.  MISCELLANEOUS
type.description: The prescribed fees shall be those specified in the Schedule as amended from time to time by order of the Minister subject to negative resolution of the National Assembly.  MISCELLANEOUS

type.name: section
type.title: Power of Commissioner to prosecute offences and take other proceedings.
type.context: LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT under Power of Commissioner to prosecute offences and take other proceedings. 15. The Commissioner, or any officer of the department, or any other person authorised in writing by the Commissioner, or any forest officer under the Forest Act, may institute or conduct, or institute and conduct,  any  prosecution  for  offences  relating  to  State  lands,  or Government lands, or under any Act or regulation relating thereto, or any proceeding for the recovery of rent or acre money or other moneys payable in respect of State or Government lands, or under any Act or regulation relating thereto.
type.description: The Commissioner, or any officer of the department, or any other person authorised in writing by the Commissioner, or any forest officer under the Forest Act, may institute or conduct, or institute and conduct,  any  prosecution  for  offences  relating  to  State  lands,  or Government lands, or under any Act or regulation relating thereto, or any proceeding for the recovery of rent or acre money or other moneys payable in respect of State or Government lands, or under any Act or regulation relating thereto.

type.name: section
type.title: Power over houses on State or Government land.  TEMPORARY PROVISIONS
type.context: LANDS DEPARTMENT ACT under Power over houses on State or Government land.  TEMPORARY PROVISIONS  16. The Commissioner, with the sanction of the President, and after notice in the Gazette for three successive Saturdays of his intention to do so, may remove and sell,  or  destroy,  any house,  erection,  or construction on State or Government land, the owner of which is not known or after reasonable inquiry cannot be found.
type.description: The Commissioner, with the sanction of the President, and after notice in the Gazette for three successive Saturdays of his intention to do so, may remove and sell,  or  destroy,  any house,  erection,  or construction on State or Government land, the owner of which is not known or after reasonable inquiry cannot be found.
